medical_history.chief_complaint: Marked edema, peripheral cyanosis, facial pallor, and tachypnea following RSV infection.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Edema developed shortly after diagnosis of RSV infection approximately 10 days before admission. He had a temperature of 39Â°C the day before admission. Despite treatment, severe edema persisted, and on the 7th day of hospitalization, he experienced a generalized tonic-clonic convulsion.
